rev.desc.rev.desc: Modified to add $pmc.actions and $apm.activity for alerts.
on the copy panel changed:
$L.fc.sql="name=\""+"problem."+nullsub(name in $G.pm.category, "")+".alerts\""
$L.alt.fc.sql="name=\"problem.alerts\""
to
$L.fc.sql="name=\""+"IM."+nullsub(name in $G.pm.category, "")+".alerts\""
$L.alt.fc.sql="name=\"IM.alerts\""
Modification made for CenterPoint Task 20808 for Request 19921.
Modified this application so that pm.delete.alert is called properly (ie, it is called to delete the deadline alert, or to delete all alerts).
See the document named CtrPntTsk20808Rqs19921.doc attached to CenterPoint Task 20808 for Request 19921 for details of what was done.
Modifed exit due to changes to the paramater panel of apm.save.problem. (Had to add two new exits due to error found on IM00088 in the betat when testing SCD.)
Modified to use the new engine code that centers on probsummary.
If an error occurs - go out the $error exit.
Recompile only.

Added several panels to update the schedule record with a class of ERROR and to set the status to a message that is appropriate for the failure. Also changed the decision panel when it checked status of record being processed and exited to normal so the it now will delete the schedule records for those situations.
Corrected "use" panel to utilize the pm.status field in the schedule record and the $L.old.status variable in determining whether or not to reassign the ticket during alert processing.
Converted to use scmsg().
removed the call to pm.eval.alerts as it is not needed at this point in the process. Gets called during the trigger processing as it should.
Changed the message on the exit.error.msg panel to "Unrecoverable error in : apm.alert"
reset the alert.time field to its original value after calling pm.eval.alerts.
Removed calls to SELECT - replaced with select.
Only reassign a ticket in DEADLINE ALERT status if the reassign flag in the assignment group is true.
Set the class of the schedule record to "problem" when rescheduling after the lock is denied.
Now uses cached SELECT instead of little baby select
Use fduplicate instead of contents on the copy panel.
Don't use isin on a decision panel. Changed to "=".
fixed exits.
Check for "problem.alerts" fc if category specific record is not found.
Don't do alerts if status="resolved".
Will now take the proper ERROR exit if it encounters an error. This will prevent an obscure situation where the scheduler would loop endlessly
Put in some trap code so an alert can never DOWNGRADE a problem's alert level

descript.descript: Modified to add $pmc.actions and $apm.activity for alerts.
on the copy panel changed:
$L.fc.sql="name=\""+"problem."+nullsub(name in $G.pm.category, "")+".alerts\""
$L.alt.fc.sql="name=\"problem.alerts\""
to
$L.fc.sql="name=\""+"IM."+nullsub(name in $G.pm.category, "")+".alerts\""
$L.alt.fc.sql="name=\"IM.alerts\""
Modification made for CenterPoint Task 20808 for Request 19921.
Modified this application so that pm.delete.alert is called properly (ie, it is called to delete the deadline alert, or to delete all alerts).
See the document named CtrPntTsk20808Rqs19921.doc attached to CenterPoint Task 20808 for Request 19921 for details of what was done.
Modifed exit due to changes to the paramater panel of apm.save.problem. (Had to add two new exits due to error found on IM00088 in the betat when testing SCD.)
Modified to use the new engine code that centers on probsummary.
If an error occurs - go out the $error exit.
Recompile only.
Corrected "use" panel to utilize the pm.status field in the schedule record and the $L.old.status variable in determining whether or not to reassign the ticket during alert processing.
Converted to use scmsg().
removed the call to pm.eval.alerts as it is not needed at this point in the process. Gets called during the trigger processing as it should.
Changed the message on the exit.error.msg panel to "Unrecoverable error in : apm.alert"
reset the alert.time field to its original value after calling pm.eval.alerts.
Removed calls to SELECT - replaced with select.
Only reassign a ticket in DEADLINE ALERT status if the reassign flag in the assignment group is true.
Set the class of the schedule record to "problem" when rescheduling after the lock is denied.
Now uses cached SELECT instead of little baby select
Use fduplicate instead of contents on the copy panel.
Don't use isin on a decision panel. Changed to "=".
fixed exits.
Check for "problem.alerts" fc if category specific record is not found.
Don't do alerts if status="resolved".
Will now take the proper ERROR exit if it encounters an error. This will prevent an obscure situation where the scheduler would loop endlessly
Put in some trap code so an alert can never DOWNGRADE a problem's alert level
